title: The Devil wears … police uniforms?
description:
Brazilian Carnaval is not only known for transforming the streets of the country into a massive and colorful party, it is also a very political celebration, with songs and costumes that often poke fun at — or downright decry — people in power.  This year’s biggest example of this dynamic came in São Paulo, amid […]

The post The Devil wears … police uniforms? appeared first on The Brazilian Report.

title: Brazil is “against Hamas,” Lula says for the first time
description:
President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva said Thursday for the first time that Brazil is “against Hamas,” and at the same time that “there is no explanation for Israel’s behavior (…) killing women and children.” According to the United Nations Children’s Fund (Unicef), thousands of children in Gaza have been killed in recent Israeli operations. […]

The post Brazil is “against Hamas,” Lula says for the first time appeared first on The Brazilian Report.

title: Embraer joins global fund aiming at increasing sustainable aviation fuel supply
description:
Brazilian planemaker Embraer, the world’s third-largest jet manufacturer, joined the United Airlines Ventures’ (UAV) Sustainable Flight Fund SM, an investment vehicle focused on scaling up the supply and availability of Sustainable Aviation Fuels (SAF) through startup investments.  The Brazilian company is the 23rd partner of the fund, which was launched in February last year. Together, […]

The post Embraer joins global fund aiming at increasing sustainable aviation fuel supply appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
